comments:
I20051116-1332 + plugin-export 20051122_1135

Have a type in a non-default package. Open the type in the editor, put the caret into the last line.

Now move the compilation unit into the default package (drag&drop or select Move... on the file in the package explorer). Move it back.

Both move operations give the following result:

This has been introduced by the line tracker changes.

Hm, IMO this is another bug in the previous version of AbstractLineTracker:

getLineNumberOfOffset(-1) == -1
getLineNumberOfOffset(-1000) == -1

vs.

getLineInformationOfOffset(-1) throws BadLocationException
getLineOffset(-1) throws BadLocationException

int toobig = (document.getLength() + 2);
getLineNumberOfOffset(toobig) throws BadLocationException
getLineInformationOfOffset(toobig) throws BadLocationException

-- 

I believe this was simply an oversight in the previous line tracker implementation. Dani, should we emulate that behavior in this case to stay bug-compatible, or call it a bug fix?
The new line tracker code is correct and will be kept. The caller has to be fixed.

Fixed in CompilationUnitEditor$RememberedOffset > 20051206

Also added a test for the line tracker behavior to LineTrackerTest3
